channel.title: Two A Little More Experienced Questions
channel.description:
1: How Can I Do So That You Cannot Logout In A Specified Place?? 2: How Do I Show A Playerhandler Timer That Already Counts Down By Clicking A Npc Or Global Object??
Thanks!!

item.title: Two A Little More Experienced Questions
item.dc:creator: @laveerre laveerre
item.description:
@laveerre wrote:

Umm… Ultimate thanks!And the caps thing, i don’t usually do that…

Read full topic

item.title: Two A Little More Experienced Questions
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

  1. Use a boolean.

public boolean inArea() { if ((absX >= #### && absX <= #### && absY >= #### && absY <= ####)) return true; else return false; }

Similar to nonWild, just fill in the coordinates. Then you need to go to your logout packet(9154 or something), and you’ll see something similar to this:

case 9154: // Log out { if (LogoutDelay >= 1) { sendMessage( "You must wait 10 seconds after combat to log out!"); } else if (LogoutDelay == 0) { logout(); savefile = true; } } break;

You then need to add your statement,

if(inArea) { //stuff }

Read full topic
item.source: Two A Little More Experienced Questions

item.title: Two A Little More Experienced Questions
item.dc:creator: @xxDiluted2xx xxDiluted2xx
item.description:
@xxDiluted2xx wrote:

As I Posted In Another Post, Why Does Everyone Type With The First Letter Capped Like This? It’s Completly Unneeded. There Is No Point In It, So Why Do They Do It? Why can’t you just type like this? With only the first letter of the ‘sentence’ capped… Anyways, back on topic. On your first question, you mean, how can you make it to where you can’t log out after 10 secs of combat? Or something like that? And for which deob, 317 or a 508ish?

Read full topic
